unnormalised: Delhiites, brace yourselves! The IMD (Indian Meteorological Department) is predicting a scorching summer this year. Expect temps to hit a high of 45°C by mid-May. Last year, on 28/05/2023, we already saw 47°C in some areas, so it could be even worse.
normalised: Delhiites, brace yourselves! The I-M-D (Indian Meteorological Department) is predicting a scorching summer this year. Expect temperatures to hit a high of forty five degree celsius by mid-May. Last year, on twenty eighth May two thousand twenty three, we already saw forty seven degree celsius in some areas, so it could be even worse.

unnormalised: The monsoon is expected to arrive late too, around 10/07/2024, give or take a week. Usually, we get some relief by the end of June. This means a longer period of intense heat. Stay hydrated, guys!
normalised: The monsoon is expected to arrive late too, around tenth July two thousand twenty four, give or take a week. Usually, we get some relief by the end of June. This means a longer period of intense heat. Stay hydrated, guys!

unnormalised: The next heatwave alert will likely be issued around 05/05/2024. Take all the necessary precautions. Avoid stepping out between 12:00 PM and 4:00 PM if you can help it. And drink plenty of water. Coconut water's a great option too!
normalised: The next heatwave alert will likely be issued around fifth May two thousand twenty four. Take all the necessary precautions. Avoid stepping out between twelve zero zero P-M and four zero zero P-M if you can help it. And drink plenty of water. Coconut water's a great option too!

unnormalised: Speaking of rain, remember the floods last year? The forecast is for normal rainfall this monsoon, but with climate change, anything's possible. Be prepared for potential waterlogging in low-lying areas like Karol Bagh and Lajpat Nagar. Keep sandbags handy, just in case.
normalised: Speaking of rain, remember the floods last year? The forecast is for normal rainfall this monsoon, but with climate change, anything's possible. Be prepared for potential waterlogging in low-lying areas like Karol Bagh and Lajpat Nagar. Keep sandbags handy, just in case.

unnormalised: Overall, the weather outlook for the next few months is a mixed bag. Get ready for extreme heat, followed by hopefully normal monsoons. Keep an eye on the news for updates and stay safe! We'll keep you posted around 20/04/2024 with any new developments.
normalised: Overall, the weather outlook for the next few months is a mixed bag. Get ready for extreme heat, followed by hopefully normal monsoons. Keep an eye on the news for updates and stay safe! We'll keep you posted around twentieth April two thousand twenty four with any new developments.
